<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 1"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Earned Glory](/Feats.aspx?ID=1444) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Half-Elf" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=85" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 47 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

</column>

---

Elves are often skeptical of their half-elven kin, and you are experienced at telling stories of your accomplishments to gain their respect. You are trained in [Performance](/Skills.aspx?ID=12). If you would automatically become trained in Performance (from your background or class, for example), you instead become trained in a skill of your choice.

 You gain the [Impressive Performance](/Feats.aspx?ID=793) feat. When you attempt a Performance check to [Make an Impression](/Actions.aspx?ID=50) on an elf, if you roll a critical failure, you get a failure instead.
name: Earned Glory
